SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.decisionSupport.model.conditionValue

Class DSValue

java.lang.Object
ca.openosp.openo.decisionSupport.model.conditionValue.DSValue
Direct Known Subclasses:
DSValueStatement, DSValueString
public abstract class DSValue extends Object
Abstract base class representing values used in clinical decision support guideline conditions.

DSValue provides a framework for parsing and evaluating various types of condition values used in clinical decision support guidelines. Values can represent medical codes (ICD-9, ICD-10, ATC), numeric ranges (age, measurement values), text patterns, or other clinical criteria.

The class supports complex parsing of condition expressions including:

  • Type-prefixed values (e.g., "icd9:250", "atc:C09AA")
  • Comparison operators for numeric values (e.g., ">=18 y", "<140 mmHg")
  • Range specifications (e.g., "18 y - 65 y")
  • Quoted string literals (e.g., "'diabetes mellitus'")
  • Unit specifications for measurements (e.g., "y" for years, "mmHg" for blood pressure)

Subclasses implement specific value types:

  • DSValueStatement - Numeric comparisons with operators
  • DSValueString - String literal matching
Since:
2009-07-06
Author:
apavel
See Also:
  • for numeric comparison values
  • for string literal values

  • Method Details

    • getValueType

      public String getValueType()
      Gets the type classification of this value. Common types include medical code systems like "icd9", "icd10", "atc", or measurement types like "age", "bp", "weight".
      Returns:
      String indicating the value type classification, may be null

    • setValueType

      public void setValueType(String valueType)
      Sets the type classification of this value.
      Parameters:
      valueType - String indicating the value type (e.g., "icd9", "atc", "age")

    • getValue

      public String getValue()
      Gets the actual value content for evaluation. This is the core data that will be matched against patient information, such as a medical code, age number, or text string.
      Returns:
      String containing the value to be evaluated

    • setValue

      public void setValue(String value)
      Sets the actual value content for evaluation.
      Parameters:
      value - String containing the value to be matched against patient data

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this DSValue. Format includes type prefix, value, and unit if present (e.g., "icd9:250", ">=18 y").
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String representation in format "type:value unit"

    • createDSValues

      public static List<DSValue> createDSValues(String values)
      Creates a list of DSValue objects from a comma-separated string of value expressions.

      Parses complex value expressions including:

      • Simple comma-separated values: "icd9:250,icd9:401"
      • Quoted string values: "'diabetes mellitus','hypertension'"
      • Range expressions: "18 y - 65 y" (creates >=18 y and invalid input: '<'=65 y)
      • Mixed expressions: "icd9:250,>=18 y,'diabetes'"
      Parameters:
      values - String containing comma-separated value expressions to parse
      Returns:
      List of DSValue objects representing the parsed expressions
      See Also:
      • for individual value parsing

    • createDSValue

      public static DSValue createDSValue(String typeOperatorValueUnit)
      Creates a single DSValue object from a formatted value expression.

      Parses individual value expressions with optional type prefix, comparison operators, and units. Examples of supported formats:

      • "icd9:250" - Medical code with type
      • ">=18 y" - Numeric comparison with unit
      • "'diabetes'" - Quoted string literal
      • "invalid input: '<'=140 mmHg" - Measurement with operator and unit
      • "F" - Simple string value

      Returns either a DSValueStatement for expressions with comparison operators or a DSValueString for simple string values.

      Parameters:
      typeOperatorValueUnit - String containing the formatted value expression to parse
      Returns:
      DSValue object (DSValueStatement or DSValueString) representing the parsed expression

    • testValue

      public abstract boolean testValue(String value) throws DecisionSupportException
      Tests whether a given value matches the criteria defined by this DSValue.

      This abstract method must be implemented by subclasses to provide specific matching logic appropriate for the value type. For example:

      • DSValueStatement performs numeric comparisons using operators
      • DSValueString performs string equality matching
      Parameters:
      value - String representation of the value to test against this DSValue's criteria
      Returns:
      boolean true if the provided value matches this DSValue's criteria, false otherwise
      Throws:
      DecisionSupportException - if the value cannot be evaluated due to format or type errors

    • getValueUnit

      public String getValueUnit()
      Gets the unit of measurement for this value. Common units include "y" (years), "m" (months), "d" (days), "mmHg" (blood pressure), "kg" (weight), etc.
      Returns:
      String indicating the unit of measurement, may be null

    • setValueUnit

      public void setValueUnit(String valueUnit)
      Sets the unit of measurement for this value.
      Parameters:
      valueUnit - String indicating the unit of measurement for the value
